abstract: Obama administration confirms it warned Russian government against further hacking into polling or registration systems eight days before presidential election; White House and some cyberattack experts disagree on effectiveness of warning; Pres-elect Donald J Trump maintains there is no evidence Russians were behind hacking and leaking of emails that took place during presidential election.

headline.print_headline: White House Used Hotline to Warn Russia Over Hacking Before Election
headline.main: White House Confirms Pre-Election Warning to Russia Over Hacking

snippet: Though there is no evidence that voting was disrupted, cybersecurity experts debated whether the warning was a success, and whether Russia had paid enough of a price....
lead_paragraph: Though there is no evidence that voting was disrupted, cybersecurity experts debated whether the warning was a success, and whether Russia had paid enough of a price.
